intro: Ruellia cayenennsis, commonly known as the Cayenne ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Ruellia cayenennsis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
